title: Brilliant Gareth Bale keeps Wales' Euro 2020 hopes alive before crucial run-in
text:
Wales 1-1 Croatia

Where there is Gareth Bale, there is always hope for Wales. Bale’s typically world-class strike – the 33rd for his country – means Ryan Giggs can enjoy his most satisfying night as Wales manager after a well-earned a draw against Croatia.

Although the full-time whistle brought lukewarm applause, Giggs felt this might be his most crucial point of the qualification stage. In time, this display might earn more praise.

Bale’s brilliant equaliser means victory in Wales’ remaining games – away against Azerbaijan and home against Hungary – should be enough to see them through, providing Slovakia do not shock Croatia.

It is still a tough ask, but more ­encouraging than when Nikola Vlasic gave Croatia a lead within 10 minutes in Cardiff. At that stage, it looked like it might become a procession for the World Cup finalists.

Giggs’s side rallied with a spirit that enthused the manager as much as the draw, given the calibre of ­opponent. There was endeavour to the Welsh comeback – an exercise in “digging in”, as the manager put it, and Bale’s moment of genius demonstrated that, so long as a ­result is in sight, he can find a way towards it.
description: Where there is Gareth Bale, there is always hope for Wales.
